page.title: 11Evolution of Westward Ho!
page.content: Before the railway came to Bideford, W.Ho! was an area of small pastoral farms with little building. With improved access by rail it became a watering place and domicile for wealthy people who built large houses and larger farms. By the late 1800's in the hope of developing a seaside resort, a pier was built in 1874. Severe winter storms demolished supports and the pier was removed in 1880. 1902 a railway built from Bideford to W.Ho! encouraged day-trippers. Lines removed for use in the 1914 world war. In the 30's transport improved W.Ho!s development as a seaside resort.In 1932 groins and the sea wall were built as a defence against the sea. With increasing population, houses and shops were built including recreation facilities upto todays holiday complex
